item.title: @blamlab @MillerLabMIT What gets people worked up is invoking "emergence" without describing what one means more clearly. My current position is that we need to use it more carefully and precisely. But in general the promise of straightforward "reduction" or "emergence" are both problematic.
item.description: @blamlab @MillerLabMIT What gets people worked up is invoking "emergence" without describing what one means more clearly. item.title:
Last year, researchers investigated aging in cold-blooded tetrapods, revealing surprisingly little evidence of physical aging in several turtle species.
The results challenge the idea that senescence is an unescapable fate. Learn more: https://t.co/iaAFEZTA0s https://t.co/YSdMWE7w7K
